docs.snippet: The State Department has begun to ban travel by Americans to Iraq and Kuwait as a "precautionary measure," saying United States passports will no longer be valid for either country.   State Department travel advisories issued on Wednesday night sa...
docs.lead_paragraph: The State Department has begun to ban travel by Americans to Iraq and Kuwait as a "precautionary measure," saying United States passports will no longer be valid for either country. State Department travel advisories issued on Wednesday night say that "all U.S. citizens are strongly urged to avoid all travel" to Kuwait and Iraq and "are advised to depart as soon as possible" from both countries "unless a special validation has been obtained."

docs.snippet: In denying review of three decisions upholding the Administration's ban on travel to Communist China, the Supreme Court kept its customary silence on the reasons for such denials. Certainly the cases met the test of public importance. Moreover, th...
docs.lead_paragraph: In denying review of three decisions upholding the Administration's ban on travel to Communist China, the Supreme Court kept its customary silence on the reasons for such denials. Certainly the cases met the test of public importance. Moreover, they tested the scope of the high court's 1958 decision that the Executive had to have explicit statutory authority to restrict travel because of a citizen's alleged subversive associations.
